meanings.definition: Belonging to something as a right or attribute.
meanings.sent1: The appurtenants features of the house included the beautiful garden and spacious garage.
meanings.sent2: The appurtenants decorations on the walls added a touch of elegance to the room.
meanings.sent3: The appurtenants curtains seemed to dance in the gentle breeze, bringing life to the otherwise still room.
meanings.sent4: Her smile, like an appurtenants jewel, brightened up the entire gathering.
meanings.sent5: The appurtenants charm of the old bookstore made it a favorite spot for book lovers.

meanings.definition: An accessory or adjunct to something.
meanings.sent1: The appurtenants of the car, such as the roof rack and cup holders, made it perfect for road trips.
meanings.sent2: She always carried her purse, phone, and other appurtenants in her backpack.
meanings.sent3: The appurtenants of his outfit, like the hat and sunglasses, completed his stylish look.
meanings.sent4: The appurtenants of the play, like the background music and lighting, enhanced the overall experience.
meanings.sent5: The appurtenants of the picnic, such as the blanket and basket, made it a delightful outing.
